dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.enterprise.risk.sec.evt.NACSecurityEvent
dataStructure.description:
NAC events are generated whenever new devices and/or users attempt to gain access to a network. The NAC event record will record the name of the network where access was attempted, the access decision (permit/deny), IP and MAC address of the device/user, and the name provided on the credential that was used to gain access X.509 subject name, MAC address, or other name. Network access may be granted on the basis of either device or user credentials depending on the local security policy.

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: NACSecurityEvent

child.name: targetNetwork
child.description:
URI-based name of the network the subject attempted to gain access to.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: targetNetwork

child.name: accessDecision
child.description:
Final decision by the NAC to permit or deny access to the network (Permit/Deny).

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is mandatory

This attribute is AVC enabled
child.label: accessDecision

child.name: nacSecurityEventSubject
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..1

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is unique

This association end is an end of association SubjectOfNACSecurityEvent

This association end is optional
child.label: nacSecurityEventSubject
